reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our flight to Sal was cancelled and we had to move hotels for the extra night we were staying on Boa Vista. Ca Nicola is a medium sized hotel, and the room we were in (I’m assuming they are all similar) are apartment rooms with kitchen including full oven & fridge.
reviews.title: A good independently run hotel in a great location
Tasteful apartments near splendid beaches
reviews.text: The place is clean & there is a semi private outside sitting area over looking the sea towards the centre of Sal Rei. Breakfast was fine, but as a vegetarian it was just bread & cheese again as I don’t have a sweet tooth, but for those with there was cake, biscuits & croissants, so plenty to choose from. This place is child friendly & it also has a stylish bar area. It is owned by an Italian who is the brother of Larissa from Spinguera.
